description: Irregular triangle of inverse totient values of integers generated recursively. Initial value is 1. The inverse-phi sets in increasing order are as follows: {1} -> {2} -> {3, 4, 6} -> {5, 7, 8, 9, 10, 12, 14, 18} -> ... The terms of each row are arranged by magnitude. The next row starts when the increase of terms is violated. 2^n is included in the n-th row.
comments: Nontotient values (A007617) are also present as inverses of some previous value.
links: T. D. Noe, Rows n=0..9 of triangle, flattened
T. D. Noe, Primes in classes of the iterated totient function, JIS 11 (2008) 08.1.2
mathematica: inversePhi[m_?OddQ] = {}; inversePhi[1] = {1, 2}; inversePhi[m_] := Module[{p, nmax, n, nn}, p = Select[Divisors[m] + 1, PrimeQ]; nmax = m*Times @@ (p/(p-1)); n = m; nn = {}; While[n <= nmax, If[EulerPhi[n] == m, AppendTo[nn, n]]; n++]; nn]; row[n_] := row[n] = inversePhi /@ row[n-1] // Flatten // Union; row[0] = {1}; row[1] = {2}; Table[row[n], {n, 0, 5}] // Flatten (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Dec 06 2012 *)
crossrefs: A058811 gives the number of terms in each row.
author: _Labos Elemer_, Jan 03 2001
extensions: Definition revised by T. D. Noe, Nov 30 2007
